It's actually more complicated than that, and even more confusing if you're not careful:
slicing series with just
is just like Numpy, i.e. upper bound excluded;
slicing dataframes by position using
.iloc[]
is like Numpy, i.e. upper bound excluded;
slicing dataframes by label using
.loc[]
is with upper bound
included
, even if the labels are integers (which is probably what confuses people most. You need to have a real grasp of row positions vs. row labels).
Things get hairy when you combine slicing by label with slicing by position, or include conditions or masks in the mix. Luckily I don't need to use slices often...
